reviewText:
The game was quite nice. Storyline has you in a virtual simulation parodying The Matrix storyline (sans for rogue Agent Smith making the world copies of himself only in the finale) and has decent radio channels once more. Grenades are traded out for superpowers like those seen from the final part of The Trouble with Clones DLC in Saints Row III (+super jump and a few other super moves.)

The two story DLC Enter the Dominatrix and How the Saints Saved Christmas are both short and well worth playing through for all the content.

The game itself also brings back a lot of older homies which makes it much better, even several enemies can become homies or Super Homies which is even better (really a fan of using Super Johnny and Super Kinzie as homies.)

Overall, would recommend buying~

reviewText:
Having never played a Saint's Row game before, I saw many of my friends playing Saint's Row IV and wondered what it was. After watching a few Let's Plays of it, I decided to pick it up and I'm glad I did.

While the driving physics are not on the level of Grand Theft Auto IV or V, the gun-play is still ♥♥♥-kickingly awesome. The game becomes incredibly easy once you've gotten a large amount of upgrades, specifically the infinite ammo for certain weapons (i.e. Rocket Launchers), but it is still fun.

Wardens are a pain in my ♥♥♥, but I love dispatching them fairly quickly (that never gets old to me). Character customization is great (I made Stone Cold Steve Austin! OH HELL YEAH!). The DLC is great (including the Director's Cut DLC which was hilarious).

Finally, there's nothing better than smacking random people upside the head with a giant purple sex toy. Buy this game!

reviewText: Saints Row 4 is fantastic, not only is it the best game in the series so far (Anyone who says otherwise is a liar or have their rose-tinted glasses on way too tight.)  but its one of the best sandbox and superhero games I have ever played. I honestly cannot see how anyone could play GTA 5 when SR4 allows you to super-speed around town slamming aliens into the pavement while You Got The Touch blares in the background or blowing crap up with a gun that shoots off killer dubstep wubs. SR4 doesn’t take itself seriously at all and I wouldn’t have it any other way. One of the few complaints I’d have is that you’re in Steelport again but the powers really do change how you view it though. Also the rift missions aren’t very fun, Insurance Fraud is amazing on the other hand. I really cannot wait for SR5 now that Volition doesn’t have their publisher going bankrupt looming over their heads, because SR4 is just too good.

reviewText:
Saints Row IV is a superhero game.

It’s about power and then more power. The fluff, the down time, the slow grind have all be stripped away. New upgrades are continuously thrown at you: now you can shoot ice from your hands and now you can run at 100MPH and now you can leap tall buildings and now..

While previous Saints Row games have found themselves compared to GTA, this feels more like Volition’s take on a Prototype or Crackdown game. A few things are lost in this transformation, driving feels like and out of place relic and the sandbox world feels more like a sandbox and less like a world than before, it’s all a bit impersonal. Also while the main story is a riotous affair, side quests are disapointingly  generic.

The game is fast paced, daft, pleasingly over the top and, well, who doesn’t want to be a superhero?

reviewText:
I found about this franchise when I bought Saints Row: The Third with all the DLCs during a Humble Bundle sale, and I didn't really enjoyed the game at first. After a few months, I decided to give the game a try by finishing it, and I really found it enjoyable, maybe a bit too much. Now I am addicted to the series, bought Saints Row IV for this reason, and I am not disappointed for doing so, since I love those games so much.

Since I like the storyline of a game, even though that game is a sandbox and is mostly focused on the world and its elements rather than the story itself, I felt a bit sad (spoiler alert) seeing how earth got blown up to pieces, since I got used to the last game where everything was pretty much normal.
Well, that sentiment left me when I found my super powers, after I upgraded them and I forgot about cars, since that is too mainstream and I start to fly around the city like a maniac, why? Because I can god dammit.

The game is really fun, even though the story is a bit shorter than the one in SR3, but the enjoyment of the game is over 9000. The game is a must buy along side with the Season Pass for some extra funny missions to try out. If you finish the game, then grab a friend and spend even more time... its like selling your soul to the devil... in a good way.

reviewText: At first I was disappointed by Saint Row IV because it recycles so much content from the previous game. However, it eventually won me over. What can I say, flying around the map and using telekinesis to throw semis at pedestrians is fun. This is pretty much the Matrix game that I wanted 15 years ago only its traded in bullet time for a sense of humor.  If you are up for a zany superhero/villain sandbox game then pick this up.

reviewText:
I purchased Saints Row IV during this year's summer sale. It was my first go on a SR game. After a little less than 35 hours I had completed the game (side missions included), and man, those 40 hours were the bomb. Basically you're caught in a simulation which is controlled by Zinyak, leader of an evil alien empire that unfortunately hates your guts.

Saints Row IV offers you a crazy but fun, well structured storyline and a whole bunch of cool characters. What I liked most was that your companions each have unique and comprehensive storylines. They might sometimes appear a little far-fetched, but it actually felt like the characters had some epth to them. You yourself are playing as The Boss, president of the United States and quite an a**hole. You can choose between a female and a male character and can even change your gender in the gam (yay!). No matter what gender you chose, romance options and dialogues remain the same (yay! again).

As it's an open world game, you've got lots of small missions to do that include killing aliens and toilets, hacking into stores, running at high speed through the city, throwing yourself in front of cars and destroying the simulation with badass weapons and vehicles. The different cars, bikes, tanks and UFOs are unlocked in missions or simply by stealing them. It's like GTA's crazy brother who doesn't get invited to any family meeting ever because he's just insane. You can get all kinds of interesting weapons too (my fave being the Dubstep Gun), which make killing aliens even more fun.

reviewText:
Saints Row IV brings to player long time of fun... well not regular fun, but damn twisted crazy fun. And believe it or not, this madness has a story. You are actually a president but unfortunately some aliens appear destroying your house (no surprise, ♥♥♥♥ happens). Then their boss, bigass alien moves you to simulation of the world... which is actually same world as in Saints  Row 3. But this time, you gain superpower. Cars are only used before you learn to super-speed-running and that will be just few minutes into the game (after intro missions). You are getting more superpowers, as you progress, like powerful stomping or telekinesis. To upgrade these powers, you have to fly across the city and collect power lighting things... and you will need to do that A LOT !

The main story missions usually bring crazy situations and... different games, that creators came up with during some friday night`s weed party - in good way of course. You may find yourself in 2D world of 90`s action shooter or in a... damnit just try that out and be surprised - thats what this game do the best.

Optional quests are not that great. They give you few tasks to do in simulation, like finish a Blazin Activity, climb a tower, kill a toilet... and for reward you get some drunk costume you wont ever use. However, it is still somehow fun :D If you want to finish all optional missions and activities, you will spend most of gameplay in simulated city flying everywhere on map, which can get pretty booring after some time. If you want to complete challenges... well have fun, see you in a month.

Oh, this review was made from my Single Player experience, but i guess co-op can be even more fun !

+ MADNESS !
+ Superpowers !
+ Co-oP option !

- Flying isnt as much fun, as driving, while cars are actually useless in this game.
- Map activities are way too easy

While SR3 had 9/10 from me, i liked it a bit more, so...

8/10 !

reviewText: Probably the best velociraptor and superhero simulator on the market currently. An excellent wrap up to the Saints Row main franchise and one of if not the best written comedy games I have ever played. Superpowers are incredibly fun to play around with endlessly and Deep Silver really outdid themselves with the amount of creative, wacky, and downright insane toys and weapons to play around with. Honestly I can't think of a single major criticism for this game, it has everything you could ever want in an open world game, outstanding amount of gameplay and content and limitless ability to do it all.

reviewText:
most people browsing these reviews are hoping to answer one question: Should I Buy This?

my answer is Yes. at the time of writing, Saint's Row IV is on sale for $4.99 - that means there's no reason not to give it a try if you haven't already.

prudes, or serious and easily-offended players won't like it because the humour is often always coarse but everyone else will probably love it.

SR-IV is a decent FPS RPG with a few buckets of off-colour jokes poured all over it. there's plenty of side-quests, sub-games and collectibles to keep you busy, and some really funny dialogue. rarely dull, *almost* never frustrating, always fun. it scores 9 out of 10 in my book.

reviewText: I enjoyed this game more than the third installment of the series. This whole superpower abilities are fun, but it makes the guns almost obsolete. The game concept got already semi-old in the third game and this one didn't change in any way, it just has the superpowers added. I hope that the new Saint's Row game will change though. Engine, gameplay, whole concept. Doesn't have to be a revolution, an evolution would be enough.\nSo - this game is really fun. It has an awesome sense of humor, the gameplay is fun and afterall it's also a good game. Nothing revolutionary or extraordinary.
